intro: Desmodium barclayi, commonly known as the pink burr legume, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its seeds are enclosed in hairy, spiny pods that help in seed dispersal. Desmodium barclayi is often found in disturbed soils and is used in ecological restoration projects due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
